definition: bodyguard
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
throwing weapon/dart/goods sent under the protection of an armed escort

sentences.english: My 6-year old brother and I became her constant bodyguards.
sentences.chinese: 我和6歲的弟弟成了她的貼身保鏢。

sentences.english: This is like a bouncer in a nightclub.
sentences.chinese: 這就像是夜總會中的保鏢。

sentences.english: Shimizu is her bodyguard and will move in if there are problems.
sentences.chinese: 清水是她的保鏢，一旦出現問題，便由他出面解決。

sentences.english: Santino Corleone: To the city. Send bodyguards with him.
sentences.chinese: 到城裏去，派保鏢跟他一起去。

sentences.english: The official was arrested along with his bodyguard who abetted him in the kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 那名官員連同唆使他綁架的保鏢雙雙被捕。

sentences.english: Jerry hasbeen my bodyguard on Sunday nights for a long time past and I amused to him.
sentences.chinese: 很久以來傑瑞就是我星期日晚上的保鏢，習慣了。

sentences.english: Blake and Ryan were sitting downstairs holding hands and had bodyguards with them.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克和瑞安坐在樓下，手牽着手，身邊還有保鏢。

sentences.english: Sell inflatable arch, model, bouncer, slide, castle, cartoon toy.
sentences.chinese: 銷售充氣拱門，模型，保鏢，滑梯，城堡，卡通玩具。

sentences.english: Al-Hassan was unhurt but five bodyguards were killed.
sentences.chinese: 部長沒有受傷，但五名保鏢被炸身亡。

sentences.english: The Bodyguard" is a fairly bog -standard thriller."
sentences.chinese: 《保鏢》是一部毫無新意的驚險電影。

sentences.english: Bodyguards are usually recruited from the ranks of former soldiers and retired members of special forces.
sentences.chinese: 保鏢通常是從招募前特種部隊士兵和退休人員的行列。

sentences.english: In many countries, politicians are increasingly popular female bodyguards.
sentences.chinese: 在很多國家，政要女保鏢正逐漸流行起來。

sentences.english: The disco bouncer threw out four drunk teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯可舞廳的保鏢把四個酒醉的青少年趕出去。

sentences.english: The actress' bodyguard was tall, dark and handsome.
sentences.chinese: 這位女演員的保鏢皮膚黝黑，又高又帥。

sentences.english: Bin Laden's then-bodyguard claimed to have delivered the dowry.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登的前保鏢則聲稱，他曾幫忙給新娘家寄過彩禮。

definition: military doctor
to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
to support/to brace
spy/informer
(military) special forces
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
special assignment (military)/special agent/operative/spy
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to attract (customers)/to drum up (trade)
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
to replace
one's own car (or motorbike)/vehicle for one's private use
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bill/to open a tab
